summary: MY CRUISE CONTROL SYSTEM DOES NOT WORK. I HAVE CHECKED ALL THE FUSES. THEY ARE ALL OK. WHEN CONTACTING SEVERAL MECHANIC AND READING ON-LINE FROM OTHER OWNERS WITH SIMILAR PROBLEM, IT IS COMMONLY REVEALED THAT  THE AIR BAG SPRING IN THE STEERING WHEEL MAY HAVE GONE BAD WHICH IS NOT UNCOMMON. THE VEHICLE, OTHERWISE IS OPERABLE. I WONDER IF THIS REVELATION IS TRUE, ARE THERE ANY OTHER SERIOUS RISKS  THAT COULD BE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 PLYMOUTH VOYAGER. THE CONTACT STATED THAT SHE HAD TO REPLACE THE WINDOW SHIELD WIPER MOTOR THREE TIMES IN A ONE YEAR PERIOD. THE CONTACT FOUND NHTSA RECALL CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 99V189000 (VISIBILITY: WINDSHIELD WIPER/WASHER LINKAGES), WHICH DEALT WITH THE DRIVER'S SIDE PIVOT ASSEMBLY. THE CONTACT SPOKE WITH THE MANUFACTURER AND WAS INFORMED THAT THERE WAS NOTHING THAT COULD BE DONE TO REPAIR THE PROBLEM. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNKNOWN AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 68,000.  UPDATED 8/8/12 *CN  UPDATED 08/14/12

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER.  THE CONTACT WAS DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 55 MPH WHEN THE VEHICLE STALLED WITHOUT WARNING.  THE CONTACT WAS ABLE TO RESTART THE VEHICLE AS IT OPERATED AS NORMAL.  THE FAILURE BEGAN TO RECUR INTERMITTENTLY SO THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO VARIOUS INDEPENDENT REPAIR FACILITIES WHERE THEY WERE UNABLE TO DIAGNOSE THE FAILURE.  THE FUEL PUMP WAS REPLACED BUT THE FAILURE CONTINUED TO RECUR INTERMITTENTLY.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 200,000 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS UNAVAILABLE.

VEHICLE HANDLING DEGRADED DUE TO REAR AXLE/BEAM FAILURE.  THE HANDLING OF THE MINIVAN WAS SIGNIFICANTLY DIFFERENT.  I INSPECTED THE VEHICLE AND NOTICED THE REAR WHEEL HAD A SIGNIFICANT NEGATIVE CAMBER WHEN IT HAS A SOLID REAR AXLE/BEAM.  I JACKED THE CAR UP AND INSPECTED THE REAR / AXLE AND BEAM AND SAW A NEAR COMPLETE RUST THROUGH OF THE REAR AXLE/BEAM.  THE RUST RESULTED IN THE REAR AXLE BENDING UPWARDS NEAR THE RIGHT REAR WHEEL CASTING/HUB.  THIS IN TURN YIELDED THE NEGATIVE CAMBER.  THE FAILURE WAS CAUGHT PRIOR TO OCCURRING WHILE AT NORMAL SPEEDS (55 MPH).  THERE IS NO QUESTION THAT IF THIS HAD FAILED AT 55 MPH IT WOULD HAVE RESULTED IN COMPLETE LOSS OF CONTROL.  THE DRIVERS SIDE REAR WHEEL ASSEMBLY WOULD HAVE ONLY BEEN HELD ON BY A SHOCK ABSORBER AND BRAKE LINE.  I HAVE NOT YET FINALIZE HOW TO REPAIR THIS BUT LOOKING AT THE REAR AXLE/BEAM ASSEMBLY IT WILL TAKE A COMPLETE REPLACEMENT OF THIS ASSEMBLY.  I'D EXPECT THIS TO BE A $2000 REPAIR.  I HAVE DETAILED PHOTOGRAPHS AND A REPORT THAT I WOULD BE GLAD TO FORWARD.  A MAJOR SUSPENSION COMPONENT SHOULD NOT RUST THROUGH TO FAILURE EVER IF IT WILL RESULT IN LOSS OF CONTROL.   THE DODGE DESIGN CONNECTS THE TWO REAR WHEELS CAST IRON HUBS VIA A THIN WALLED TUBE.  THIS THIN WALL TUBE KEEPS THE REAR WHEELS ALIGNED AND AT THE CORRECT CAMBER.  THIS TUBE RUSTED THROUGH SUCH THAT THE MAIN SUPPORT TYING THE WHOLE REAR SUSPENSION TOGETHER IS LOST.  THIS VAN SPENT SEVERAL YEARS IN NY.  I WOULD SAY ANY DODGE MINIVAN RUNNING IN THE NORTH EAST IS AT A SIGNIFICANT RISK OF THIS FAILURE. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER.  THE CONTACT IS EXPERIENCING A LEAK IN THE FUEL SYSTEM NEXT TO THE EXHAUST MANIFOLD.  HE TOOK HIS VEHICLE TO THE LOCAL DEALER AND WAS INFORMED THAT HIS VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 00V268000 (FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:FUEL INJECTION SYSTEM).  THEY REPLACED THE FUEL RAIL, BUT WOULD NOT REPAIR IT WITH A FREE SERVICE CHARGE.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 180,000.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER.  WHILE DRIVING 4 MPH, THE REAR DRIVER SIDE AXLE SNAPPED.  THE VEHICLE SHOOK VIOLENTLY AND THE CONTACT HEARD A SQUEALING NOISE RIGHT BEFORE THE FAILURE OCCURRED.  THIS IS THE FOURTH TIME THAT THE AXLE HAS BEEN TOWED AND REPAIRED.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE IS 115,000 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 110,000.

FATIGUE CRACKING OF THE DRIVER'S SIDE DOOR HINGE PILLAR AROUND THE HINGE.  THE CRACK HAS PROGRESSED ROUGHLY 50% OF  THE WAY AROUND THE HINGE AND WILL LEAD TO COMPLETE SEPARATION OF THE HINGE FROM THE PILLAR WITHOUT REPAIR.  THIS CAR HAS HAD NO ACCIDENTS.  THE INCIDENT DATE IS THE APPROXIMATE DATE THE CRACK WAS FIRST DETECTED.  *JB

NHTS CAMPAIGN 99V189000 CONCERNS A FAILURE OF WINDSHIELD WIPER LINKAGES ON 1993 PLYMOUTH VOYAGERS LEADING TO TOTAL LOSS OF WIPER FUNCTION.  THIS HAPPENED TO MY DAUGHTER TODAY DURING A STORM, FORCING HER TO RETURN HOME VERY SLOWLY.  NO ACCIDENT, NO ONE HURT.  (NOTE THAT I AM A REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER.)    UPON HER RETURN, I INSPECTED AND FOUND THAT:  1.  THE WIPER MOTOR WAS RUNNING AND COULD BE AUDIBLY HEARD WHILE THE WIPERS SAT MOTIONLESS.  2.  THE TWO WIPERS WERE LINKED TOGETHER AND COULD BE MOVED EASILY BY HAND. 3.  THE RUNNING WIPER MOTOR WOULD NOT MOVE THE WIPERS.  AT THAT POINT I REMOVED THE 3 BOLTS HOLDING THE WIPER MOTOR IN PLACE AND LOOKED INSIDE THE WIPER ARM CAVITY.  I FOUND WIPER DRIVE ARM TO BE DETACHED FROM THE ROTATING ARM ON THE DRIVE MOTOR SHAFT.  I HAVE DIGITAL PHOTOGRAPHS AVAILABLE IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO SEE THEM.  THE REASON FOR MY REPORT IS THIS:  THE VAN WHICH THIS HAPPENED TO IS A 1994  GRAND VOYAGER, SAME BODY STYLE AS THE 1993.  HOW DOES ONE SUGGEST THAT THE 1994 MODEL SHOULD ALSO BE RECALLED?  REGARDS,  JEFF BOX JEFFBOX@IEEE.ORG.  *NM

CONSUMER CLOSED THE SLIDING PASSENGER DOOR WHICH HAS BEEN DIFFICULT TO OPEN AND CLOSE FOR SOME TIME, AND CURRENTLY IT FELL OFF. ALSO, WHEN DRIVING THE AUTOMATIC LOCKS KEPT LOCKING, AND THE BELL KEPT GOING ON.  THE INTERIOR LIGHTS FLASHED, AND THE DOOR AJAR LIGHT CAME ON.*AK

WHILE DRIVING 70 MPH, THE VEHICLE WAS INVOLVED IN A FRONTAL COLLISION.   BOTH FRONTAL AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY AND BOTH FRONTAL SEAT BELTS FAILED TO LOCK.  THIS CAUSED THE PASSENGER TO SUSTAINED MINOR INJURIES AND WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL.   THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A GARAGE.   THE CAUSE HAS NOT BEEN DETERMINED AT THIS TIME.   PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER DETAILS. *JB  *TC

WITHOUT WARNING THE TOP HINGE OF THE HYDRAULIC LIFT OF THE TAILGATE SNAPPED WHILE I WAS DRIVING.  HYDRAULIC "TUBE" WAS SENT INTO THE CEILING OF THE VAN, CAUSING THE INTERIOR AND CEILING TO HAVE SEVERE DAMAGE.  HATCH CANNOT BE OPENED WITHOUT REMOVING HYDRAULIC ASSEMBLY.*AK

CAR WAS RECALLED TO CORRECT AIR BAG LIGHT MALFUNCTION, BUT PRESENTLY THE AIRBAG LIGHT CONTINUED TO COME ON, AND IT SMELLED AS IF SOMETHING ELETRICAL WAS BURNING.  MY RADIO WENT OUT, THE INTERIOR LIGHTS WOULDN'T COME ON  AND THE CAR SIMPLY WOULDNOT EVEN TURN OVER.  THE CAR WAS REPAIRED, SITING A FUSE ON 11/23/04.  THE SMELL OF BURNING RUBBER OR SOMETHING ELECTRICAL WAS NOTED , THE INTERIOR LIGHTS WENT DIM, LIGHTS APPEARED ON DASH, SPEED WAS REDUCED SO RAPIDLY IT FELT AS IF SOMETHING HAS FALLEN FROM THE BOTTOM OF VEHICLE.  I BELIEVE THAT MY INSTRUMENT CLUSTER PANEL IS SHORTING OUT DUE TO THIS MALFUNCTION.  PLEASE HELP ME.*AK

PLASTIC HEADLIGHTS GET CLOUDY AND SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCE LIGHT OUTPUT AND THUS VISIBILITY DURING NIGHT TIME DRIVING.  I HAVE EXPERIENCED THIS WITH SEVERAL CHRYSLER CORPORATION MINIVANS AND A NISSAN ALTIMA, HOWEVER, A QUICK TOUR THRU A PARKING LOT WILL IDENTIFY NUMEROUS CAR MAKES AND MODELS WITH CLOUDED HEADLIGHTS.   IF THE PLASTIC CAN'T BE MANUFACTURED IN A WAY THAT PREVENTS IT FROM GETTING CLOUDY OR YELLOW, MANUFACTURERS SHOULD BE REQUIRED TO USE GLASS. *AK

WHILE DRIVING 70 MPH, THE VEHICLE STALLED WITHOUT WARNING.  THE CONSUMER WAS ABLE TO RESTART THE VEHICLE.  THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE DEALER FOR INSPECTION.   THE MECHANIC COULD NOT DUPLICATE THE PROBLEM.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER DETAILS.   *JB

I WAS DRIVING A GROUP OF STUDENTS WHEN I HEARD A LOUD EXPLOSION AND LOST ALL GEARS ON MY TRANSMISSION. I STOPPED THE VEHICLE, TRIED TO PUT IT IN PARK AND IT KEPT ROLLING. THE INTERIOR OF THE TRANSMISSION HAD BLOWN. AT THE SAME TIME, IT BLEW OUT THE STARTER AND THE MAIN DRIVE. IF I CAN FIND A USED OR REBUILT TRANSMISSION, IT WILL COST ME $1,000 FOR THE TRANSMISSION PLUS LABOR COSTS. BEEN SEARCHING 2 WEEKS WITH NO LUCK. IT'S ABOUT TIME SOMEONE TAKES THESE REPORTS SERIOUSLY. AN INVESTIGATION NEEDS TO BE STARTED. I BOUGHT THIS VAN FROM MY DAD WHO REPLACED THE TRANSMISSION IN 1999. IT'S 2004 AND IT NEEDS REPLACED AGAIN.*AK

THIS IS IN REGARDS TO THE GEN 3 SEAT BELTS    I DON'T REALLY HAVE A COMPLAINT BECAUSE NOTHING HAS HAPPENED TO US IN OUR VEHICLE, HOWEVER, I FEEL THAT THIS IS AN ISSUE THAT NEEDS FURTHER INVESTIGATION.  AS AN OWNER OF A 1994 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER, I AM CONCERNED FOR THE SAFETY OF MY FAMILY.   *LA

COOLING SYSTEM  FAN BROKE BECAUSE OF THE ALUMINUM BRACKET THAT HELD IT IN PLACE. THE BRACKET WAS ATTACHED TO A STEEL ROD WHICH CAUSED TOO MUCH STRESS AND EVENTUALLY RESULTED IN THE FAN BRACKETS  BREAKING.  THIS PROBLEM HAD OCCURRED TWICE.  *AK    *TS  *JB

THE DRIVER SIDE AIRBAG ON OUR 1994 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER DEPLOYED WHILE DRIVING AT APPROX 30 MPH.  THERE WAS NO COLLISION, ROAD BUMPS OR ANYOTHER PHYSICAL JARRING OF THE VEHICLE.  THERE WAS NO CAUSE FOR THE AIRBAG TO DEPLOY.  THE DRIVER (MY WIFE) SUSTAINED MINOR INJURIES (BROKEN NOSE, CUT LIPS AND BRUSING) AND SHE WAS ABLE TO STOP THE VEHICLE SAFELY.  FORTUNATELY SHE WAS NOT ON A MAJOR HIGHWAY.     THIS WAS REPORTED TO CHRYSLER, WHO HAS BEEN VERY UNCOOPERATIVE AND RUDE.  THE CHRYSLER SPECIAL INVESTIGATIONS FILE NUMBER IS 11586772 (WE HAVE NOT HEARD FROM THEM).*AK

2 ITEMS OF CONCERN.   THE AIRCONDITIONING UNIT HAS FAILED.  WE OWN A BLUE GRAND VOYAGER MINIVAN AND THE PAINT IS PEELING FROM THE ROOF AND ENGINE HOOD OF THE CAR.  WE HAVE NOTICED MANY OF THE SAME COLOR AND YEAR TRUCKS, VANS AND CARS WITH FAILING PAINT.  A RECALL SHOULD HAPPEN.  PAINT SHOULD NOT START PEELING AFTER 4 YEARS OF A CARS LIFE.*AK

NO FAILURE ON THIS VEHICLE I OWN A VEHICLE WITH GEN 3 SEAT BELTS SUBJECT TO A CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT, AND I AM REPORTING THIS TO THE NHTSA.  DT

PULLED OUT OF  THE DRIVEWAY THE MORNING OF JANUARY 8, 2002 AND INTO TRAFFIC. FELT A HARD JERK AND HEARD A STRANGE WINDING NOISE. THE TRANSMISSION WOULD NOT SHIFT OUT OF FIRST GEAR. TOOK THE VAN TO THE DEALER AND THEY SAID THE TRANSMISSION WAS SHOT FROM AN INTERNAL FAILURE AND WOULD NEED A NEW TRANSMISSION. THE DEALER INSTALLED A NEW TRANSMISSION AT A COST OF $2147.28 WITH A 3 YEAR / 36,000 MILE WARRANTY.*AK
WHILE DRIVING 30 MPH  BELT TENSIONER BROKE, CAUSING VEHICLE TO LOSE STEERING AND BRAKES.*AK  *MJ

THE PART THAT HAD BEEN REPLACED IS COONDIERED A NON-WEAR ITEM.  THIS PART SHOULD NOT HAVE BROKEN IN HALF. I WANTED TO SEE IF THE NHTSA HAD RECEIVED ANY OTHER COMPLAINTS, AND TO SEE IF THERE IS RECOURSE BACK TO THE MANUFACTURER FOR THE FAILURE OF THE TORSION BAR.  THANK YOU FOR TAKING MY CONCERN...PATRICK ADAMO 574-257-3153. *AK

CONSUMER STATED VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER TO HAVE RECALL 99V113000 PERFORMED, HOWEVER THE PART THAT WAS NEEDED HAD TO BE ORDERED, AND CONSUMER WAS INFORMED THAT WHEN THE PART CAME IN HE WOULD RECEIVE A CALL, CONSUMER NEVER RECEIVED A CALL, CONSUMER TOOK THE VEHICLE BACK TO THE DEALER REGARDING ANOTHER RECALL AND THEN MENTIONED THE AIRBAG RECALL AND THAT THE LIGHT WAS COMING ON INTERMITTENTLY, THE DEALER STATED THE PART WOULD HAVE TO BE ORDERED, CONSUMER WAS THEN INFORMED THAT THE PROBLEM WITH THE AIRBAG WAS NOT RELATED TO THE RECALL, AND THE CONSUMER WOULD BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE REPAIRS, CONSUMER WAS INFORMED THAT THE CLOCKSPRING NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.*JB

I WAS SITTING IN A PARKING LOT WAITING FOR MY MOTHER TO PAY A BILL. I HAD MY ENGINE OFF, BUT THE POWER WAS ON.  I HAD MY POWER WINDOW DOWN.  MY  TWO YEAR OLD WAS LOOKING OUT OF THE WINDOW.  SHE STEPPED UP AND HER FOOT PRESSED ON THE POWERWINDOW BUTTON AND THE WINDOW RAISED UP ON HER HEAD AND MADE A MARK ON HER CHEEK. I TRIED TO STOP THE WINDOW WITH THE BUTTON ON MY SIDE TO QUICKLY STOP THE WINDOW FROM RAISING, BUT IT WOULDN'T OVERRIDE HER BUTTON.  I QUICKLY REACHED OVER AND GOT THE BUTTON DOWN, BUT IF HER HEAD HAD BEEN OUT OF THE WINDOW MORE, IT WOULD PROBABLY HAVE BROKEN HER NECK!  THERE NEEDS TO BE A SAFETY WARNING ISSUED TO PREVENT A CHILD FROM GETTING HURT OR KILLED. I HAD NEVER THOUGHT ABOUT THIS HAPPENING. HAD I BEEN STANDING OUTSIDE THE CAR, ETC., IT WOULD HAVE CAUSED SERIOUS INJURY AND/OR POSSIBLE DEATH.*AK
CONSUMER HAD REPLACED  LIGHT FUSE A FEW TIMES.  HAD TAKEN VEHICLE TO DEALER, BUT COULD NOT BE FIXED, AND EACH TIME HAD BURNED A FUSE.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.*AK
WHILE DRIVING  AIR BAG LIGHT WILL COME ON AND OFF, BUT LATELY HAD STAYED  ON.  DEALER COULD NOT FIND  CAUSE OF IT.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.*AK

WHILE DRIVING  WHEELS WILL GO TO THE SIDES WHERE SOMETIMES COULD NOT CONTROL VEHICLE. HAD CONTACTED DEALER FOR THE SITUATION AND THEY HAD PERFORMED ALIGMENT TO FIX THE PROBLEM, BUT STILL   IS THE SAME.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.*AK
CONSUMER  HAD EXPERIENCED SOME PROBLEMS WITH SUSPENSION.  WHERE IT MAKES NOISE.  CONSUMER HAD CONTACTED  DEALER ABOUT IT.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.*AK
CONSUMER  IS UNABLE TO CLOSE  REAR DOOR. IT  HAS TO BE FORCED IN.  HAD TAKEN TO DEALER, WHERE THEY FIXED IT FOR A WHILE, BUT IS BROKE AGAIN.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.*AK

EXCESSIVE TIRE WEAR ON OUTER EDGE OF TIRES.  THIRD SET OF TIRES IN 35K MILES.  ALIGNMENT HAS ALWAYS BEEN CHECKED AND HAS ALWAYS BEEN IN SPEC.  TIRES HAVE BEEN RATED FOR 50 TO 70K MILES ONLY GETTING 15K.  MAYBE THE AWD THAT IS CAUSING IT??  FRONT STRUTS WERE REPLACED BEFORE I BOUGHT THE CAR.  I AM IN THE PROCESS OF REPLACING THEM AGAIN WITH NEW REAR SHOCKS (MONROE REFLEX).  THIS IS THE SECOND GRAND VOYAGER.  FIRST ONE NEVER HAD ANY PROBLEMS UNDER THE SAME DRIVING CONDITIONS.  DEALER HAS NO EXPLANATION EXCEPT TO INCREASE TIRE PRESSURE.  I WANT TO KNOW IF THIS IS AN ISOLATED PROBLEM OR NOT AND WHAT I CAN DO TO GET IT CORRECTED.*AK

summary: WHILE DRIVING 55 MPH  VEHICLE STALLED,  DEALER REPLACED A LEAKING FUEL LINE. VEHICLE HAS STALLED SINCE. I WAS ON THE INTERSTATE, STRANDED IN THE MIDDLE OF NO WHERE!!  THIS IS THE SECOND FAILURE OF THIS TRANSMMISION, I CAN'T BELIEVE THAT THEY DO RECALLS FOR SMALL ITEMS, BUT WHEN IT COMES TO LARGE EXPENSIVE PROBLEMS THEY LEAVE YOU HANGING!!*AK

THIS IS THE SECOND  BLOW OUT OF THESE TIRES AND ONE FLAT TIRE SINCE BOUGHT .  THE  FIRST BLOW OUT WAS STRIAGHT ACROSS THE TOP OF THE "W" IN WINSTON  TIRE LOGO TWO WEEKS AFTER BUYING THE SET.  I WAS DRIVE THRU A CONSTRUCTION SITE.  THE DRIVERS SIDE FRONT WENT THRU A SMALL POT HOLE , THE REAR TIRE JUST WENT FLAT. IT  WAS A SATURDAY MORNING  AND THE WINSTON DEALER DID NOT WANT TO TAKE CARE OF THE TIRE DID NOT GET ME IN WEDENSDAY AT THE SOONEST. THEY WOULD ROAD HAZARD THE TIRE,I FEEL THIS WAS A BAD TIRE.   THEY WANTED TO SELL ME ANOTHER ROAD HAZARD.  WHILE ON A TRIP TO MONTANA AND BACK TO PHOINEX  AZ. A PEICE OF MONTANA ROAD SAND WHEN THE FACE OF  ONE OF THE TIRES (THEY STILL HAVE NOT PAID THE FLAT REPAIR). WHILE THERE I ASKED THEM TO GIVE ME THEIR OPION OF THESE TIRES.  THEIR ANSWER WAS NOT DRIVE ON GRAVEL AT ALL AND DON'T HIT ANYTHING BIGGER THAN A PIECE OF GRAVEL.  THE LAST BLOWOUT WAS WHILE TRYING TO DO A U-TURN.  I HAD TO PULL UP ON TO THE CURVE.  IT BLOWOUT AS SOON TIRE TOUCHED THE CURB.  I KNOW MY SPEED WAS LESS THAN 15MPH.  FOR I DID NOT TO DO A FRONT END ALINEMENT.  THE PLACE WHERE THIS TIRE BLOW OUT WAS THE SAME AS THE OTHER.   IN THE PAST YEARS NOW MY OWN RIGS I HAVE HAD TWO BLOW OUTS, ONE RUNNING OVER A RAILROAD SPIKE AND THE OTHER A STICK THUR SIDE WALL. I HAVE ALSO WORKED IN A TIRE SHOPS BEFORE AND DID ALMOST ALL MY OWN TIRES  WHILE DRIVING LOG TRUCKS IN MONTANA FOR SEVEN YEARS.  FOR THEY HAVE TOLD  ME THAT I DON'T KNOW WHAT I TALKING ABOUT.*AK (DOT NUMBER: WNS19018  TIRESIZE: 205/70/15)

THE COMPRESSOR FAILURE HAS OCCURRED IN ALL CHRYSLER PRODUCTS OF A PRIOR YEAR.  IT HAS BEEN DESCRIBED AS A DEFAULTED PART BY THE DEALER AND SEVERAL OTHER ASE CERTIFIED TECHNICIANS INCLUDING SEARS AND PEP BOYS.  THESE REPAIR FACILITIES HAVE COMMENTED ON THE NUMBER OF REPLACEMENTS THEY HAVE HAD TO DO ON THE CHYRSLER PRODUCTS ON THE SAME PART DUE TO THE FAULTY PART.  THE FAILURE OCCURS ON THE VEHICLE AT VARIOUS MILEAGE READINGS  SOME EARLY AND SOME LATE MODEL CARS.  IT SHOULD BE RECALLED AND REPLACED AT THE MANUFACTURERS EXPENSE SINCE THEY ARE AWARE OF THE DEFECTIVE PART AND DECIDED NOT TO FIX IT BEFORE LEAVING THE MANUFACTURER BUSINESS.*AK

WHILE OPENING THE TAILGATE ON THE VEHICLE, MY DAUGHTER WAS PREPARING TO LOAD MERCHANDISE INTO THE REAR . WHILE SHE WAS UNDER THE OPENING TAILGATE A SUPPORT PIVOT SHEARED OFF AT THE BODY. THE TAILGATE CAME DOWN ON HER HEAD. THE SUPPORT WENT TO A FULLY EXTENDED POSITION. IT LODGED BETWEEN THE REAR INTERIOR PANEL AND THE REAR BODY WORK. ONCE MY DAUGHTER WAS OUT FROM UNDER THE TAILGATE, THE TAILGATE CLOSED. BUT BECAUSE THE SUPPORT WAS FULLY EXTENDED IT CONTINUED UP THROUGH THE INTERIOR OF THE VAN,PUT A HOLE IN THE INTERIOR ROOF PANEL AND THE END OF THE SUPPORT ABRAIDED WIRING ABOVE THE ROOF PANEL CAUSING THE FUSE FOR THE AIR BAGS AND THE REAR WINDOW WIPER/WASHER TO BLOW. AS A RESULT THE DASH MOUNTED AIR BAG WARNING LIGHT CAME ON AND OF COURSE THE REAR WIPER WAS INOP. I TOOK THE VAN INTO THE DEALER, BECAUSE I READ ON YOUR WEBSITE OF A RECALL PERTAINING TO THE LIFTGATE SUPPORTS. HE INFORMED ME THAT MY VAN WAS FIXED ONCE UNDER THE RECALL NOTICE AND THERE WAS NOTHING HE COULD DO FOR ME. (HE DIDN'T EVEN GIVE ME THE TIME OF DAY TO LOOK AT WHAT HAD HAPPENED!) I REQUESTED THE PHONE # FOR CHRYSLER CONSUMER SERVICES, WHICH HE GAVE ME. CHRYSLER TOLD ME TO RE-CONTACT THE DEALERSHIP AND THAT IF UPON INSPECTION THE DEALER FINDS THAT THE BROKEN PIVOT IS COVERED BY THE RECALL (#730) THEY WOULD FIX IT. OTHERWISE I.M LIABLE FOR THE REPAIRS.  TO DATE , I HAVE RESCHEDULED THE APPOINTMENT WITH THE DEALER.

I PURCHASED THIS VAN IN FERUARY 1997. IT HAD 40,683 MILES ON IT. THE VAN DEVELOPED A SEVERE VIBRATION IN THE DRIVE TRAIN ON ACCELERATIION FROM A STOP AND WHEN ACCELERATING AT SPEED WITH PASSING GEAR AND WITHOUT PASSING GEAR. THE TRANSMISSION CASE WAS REPLACED ONCE (BROKEN CASE), REPLACED ONCE AND IS NOW IN SHOP FOR REPLACEMENT AGAIN. THIS VEHICLE WILL LOCK UP IN LOWER GEARS WHEN ACCELERATING MAKING FOR DANGEROUS OPERATION. DEALERS ADMIT THERE IS A PROBLEM WITH THIS TRANSMISSION AND I HAVE CONFIRMED THIS PROBLEM FROM MANY OTHER PEOPLE AND TSBS. THIS DEFECT SHOULD BE A RECALL CONDITION ON ALL VANS WITH THIS PROBLEM. I ALSO FEEL THIS PROBLEM(VIBRATION) HAS CAUSED PREMATURE DAMAGE TO THE MAIN BEARINGS AND CONSEQUENT INTERNAL ENGINE DAMAGE.       INTERNAL DAMAGE TO THE ENGINE

WE PURCHASED THIS VEHICLE ONE YEAR AGO FROM REALATIVE.  AT THAT TIME IT HAD 45,000 MILES ON IT.  THEY PURCHASED THE VEHICLE USED FROM A DEALER WITH 38,000 MILES ON IT.  SINCE OWNING THE VEHICLE WE HAVE HAD TROUBLE WITH THE TRANSMISSION LOCKING INTO LOW GEAR AND HAVING TO "LIMP" TO OUR DESTINATION; IT SHIFTS ABRUPTLY WHEN DOWNSHIFTING; A COMPONENT HAS FAILED, MAKING THE VAN WANT TO SHIFT INTO OVERDRIVE WHILE TRING TO MAINTAIN A SPEED OF 35-40 MPH; AND THE MOST RECENT PROBLEM IS THAT WHILE DRIVING TO WORK I LOST ALL FORWARD GEARS.  THE VAN IS DRIVEABLE AT THIS TIME.  TWO SEPERATE CHRYSLER DEALERS HAVE LOOKED AT THE VAN AND ARE UNABLE TO DETERMINE WHY THIS HAPPENED; WHAT CAUSED IT OR HOW TO REPAIR IT OTHER THEN REPLACING THE ENTIRE TRANSMISSION, AT A COST OF APPROXIMATELY $2,000.00  THEY DO NOT GUARENTEE THAT THIS WILL CURE THE PROBLEM.  EVERYONE I SPEAK WITH WHO HAS OWNED, OR HAS HAD A FAMILY MEMBER OWN A 1994 GRAND VOYAGER/ CARAVAN, HAS HAD MULTIPLE PROBLEMS WITH THE TRANSMISSION.  I HAVE SPOKEN WITH PEOPLE WHO HAVE HAD FACTORY REBUILT TRANSMISSION INSTALLED, AND HAVE HAD CONTINUED PROBLEMS.  THE NHTSA DATABASE IS FILLED WITH PEOPLES COMPLAINTS ABOUT THESE TRANSMISSIONS.  66,200 MILES ON A VEHICLE IS NOT MUCH, ESPECIALLY FOR A TRANSMISSION.  I HAVE CONTACTED CHRYSLER TO SEE IF THEY WOULD OFFER SOME TYPE OF ASSISTANCE WITH THIS PROBLEM, BUT THEY REFUSE.  I WOULD ASK THAT NHTSA SERIOUSLY LOOK AT THIS ISSUE CLOSELY.  HAVING HEARD SO MANY STORIES FROM INDIVDUALS; HAVING FOUND WEB SITES FILLED WITH PEOPLES STORIES OF FAILED TRANSMISSIONS, AND FROM YOUR OWN DATABASE, IT APPEARS THAT THERE IS SOMETHING SERIOUSLY WRONG WITH THE TRANSMISSIONS THAT CHRYSLER HAS USED IN THESE VEHICLES.  *AK
THE TRANSMISSION FAILED THREE TIMES IN 6 YEARS. THE FIRST WAS BARELY OVER WARRANTY.  TO MANY COMPLAINTS TO REGISTER IN ONE SITTING!  SO MUCH FOR A RELIABLE FAMILY VEHICLE.  *AK

RECALL OF THE PASSIVE RESTRAINT AIRBAG TOOK TO MASON MOTOR SALES TO HAVE FIXED THEY SAID THEY FIXED IT . I AM GUESSING THAT IT WONT.  *AK

THE ESTIMATED COST FOR REPAIR IS BETWEEN 500.00 TO 800.00 DOLLARS DEPENDING ON WHAT HE FINDS. HAVEN,T HAD THE WORK DONE YET. WAS WONDERING IF THERE WAS ANY RECALLS ON THIS PROBLEM.  *AK

ENGINE STALLS IN TRAFFIC. STALLED UNDER HIGHWAY DRIVING CONDITIONS (65MPH) AND LOCAL DRIVING SITUATIONS AT BOOTOM OF HIGHWAY EXIT RAMPT AND AT STOP SIGNS AND TRAFFIC SIGNALS.  ALL GAUGES REGISTERED AT MID-RANGE AT TIME OF ALL STALLS.  ENGINE WILL RESTART AFTER WAITING A PERIOD OF TIME.  ENGINE SEEMS LESS PRONE TO STALLING WHEN THE ENGINE REMAINS BELOW 2000 RPM AND AIR-CONDITIONING AND RADIO ARE OFF.  LOCAL MECHANIC ALONG WITH THE PLYMOUTH DEALER WERE UNABLE TO DETERMINE THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURE.  OTHER NEIGHBORS HAVE SIMILAR PROBLEMS ON THE SAME MAKE/MODEL.  *AK
THE PASSENGER SEATBELT MOUNT FELL OFF THE VEHICLE DURING NORMAL USE, IT SIMPLY BECAME UNBOLTED FROM THE WALL OF THE VEHICLE.  NLM

I EXPERIENCED SIGNIFICANT LOSS OF CONTROL AT HIGHWAY SPEED WHEN AUTO TRANSMISSION DECIDED TO SELF DESTRUCT.  DEALER'S COMMENTS WERE HOW "LUCKY" I WAS THAT MY ORIGINAL TRANSMISSION LASTED TO 100000 MILES, AS MOST DO NOT LAST THAT LONG.  THE MOPAR FACTORY REBUILT REPLACEMENT LASTED ONLY 12000 MILES, BUT I DID NOT EXPERIENCE RAPID DISINTEGRATION AS WITH THE FIRST, ONLY "SLIPPAGE" AND INABLITY TO PROCEED IN ANY DIRECTION.  THIS APPEARS TO BE A MAJOR PROBLEM WITH MINIVANS, PROBABLY AN INDIRECT AND DIRECT CAUSE OF ACCIDENTS AND PERSONAL INJURY.  PLEASE DO SOMETHING.  *AK

PROBLEM #1 - RAIN WATER ENTERING VEHICLE.  WE LIVE IN SEATTLE, IT RAINS 50% OF THE YEAR.  EVERYTIME IT RAINS, FOR THE LAST 3-4 YEARS, WATER ENTERS THE VEHICLE.  WE'VE TAKEN THE VEHICLE TO A FACTORY AUTHORIZED WATER LEAK DETECTION COMPANY, AFTER 1-2 YEARS AND ABOUT $500 IN BILLS, THEY GAVE UP.  THEY FOUND A NEW LEAK EVERYTIME WE BROUGHT THE CAR IN.  AS OF LAST THURSDAY, 2/24/2000 , THEY FINALLY GAVE UP, SAID THEY COULD NOT JUSTIFY FINDING MORE LEAKS!!  IN ALL THEY FOUND 6 LEAKS, NONE OF WHICH WERE FAILED SEALS OR OTHERWISE PARTS THAT WOULD WEAR OUT OVER TIME.   ALL FOUND LEAKS WERE BODY WELDS AND OTHER FACTORY DEFECTS. WE'VE ALSO TAKEN THE CAR TO GLASS INSTALLATION STORES, ETC.  NOBODY, SO FAR CAN DETECT WHERE ALL THE LEAKS ARE COMING FROM.  WATER LEAK TECHNIQUES SAID THAT ALL OF THE LEAKS THEY FOUND WERE FACTORY DEFECTS.  WHAT'S OUR NEXT STEP?  WE JUST WANT A DRY CAR.   OUR 2ND & 3RD PROBLEM MAY BE RELATED, AND HAVE BEEN OCCURING ALMOST SINCE THE CAR WAS NEW.  BASICALLY, THE CAR WILL STALL WHILE DRIVING SLOWLY.  LIKE WHEN STARTING OUT AT A TRAFFIC LIGHT OR DRIVING THROUGH A PARKING LOT.  THE NEXT PROBLEM, THE TRANSMISSION SHIFTS ROUGHLY, USUALLY WHEN THE ENGINE IS WARM, SOMETIMES THE TRANSMISSION HAS TROUBLE SHIFTING INTO THE NEXT GEAR, ALMOST LIKE THE "BRAIN" DOESN'T TELL IT TO SHIFT.  WE LIKE OUR MINI-VAN, WE ONLY HAVE ABOUT 45,000 ORIGINAL MILES ON IT.  WE HAVE SPENT HUNDREDS OF DOLLARS TRYING TO REMEDY THE 3 PROBLEMS, CAN YOU HELP?  THIS VEHICLE HAS NEVER BEEN IN AN ACCIDENT.  THE VEHICLE HAS HAD REGULAR MAINTENANCE.  IREAD OVER THE RECALL ITEMS FOR OTHER 1994 CHRYSLER MODELS, ONE RECALL SOUNDS SIMILAR NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID# 94VO24000. *AK

TRANSMISSION UNDERWENT MAJOR REPAIR AT 59,653 MILES UNDER 7/70 WARRANTY.  THIS TIME REPAIR IS OUT OF WARRANTY.  LAST TIME THE TRANSMISSION WOULD SLAM INTO GEAR AS IT WAS SHIFTING. THE VEHICLE IS CURRENTLY BEING REPAIRED AT WESTOAKS CHRYSLER, 3839 AUTO MALL DRIVE, THOUSAND OAKS, CA, 1-800-748-6118.  THEY ALSO REPAIRED THE VEHICLE IN FEB 1998 UNDER WARRANTY. SINCE JULY 1999 MY MINI-VAN HAS BEEN STALLING AND LOOSING POWER SUDDENLY.  THE DEALERSHIP HAS SEEN THE VAN 3 TIMES AND THE PROBLEM PERSISTS. THIS IS THE SECOND COMPLAINT FOR THE SAME PROBLEM I HAVE SENT THE NTSA.  I HAVE BEEN DEALING WITH THIS PROBLEM FOR 4 MONTHS NOW AND AM NOT GETTING ANY COOPERATION FROM THE DEALER OR MANUFATURE.

IN MAY OF 1996 I NOTICED THAT THE PAINT ON THE ROOF OF THE MINI-VAN WAS PEELING VERY BAD.  MY HUSBAND WAS TRAVELING AROUND THE COUNTRY IN THE VAN AND WE WERE THEREFORE UNABLE TO HAVE IT CHECKED OUT IMMEDIATELY.  AS TIME PASSED, THE PEELING WORSENED AND OTHER AREAS ALSO STARTED TO PEEL (THE HOOD, THE DRIVER SIDE DOOR) AND MY HUSBAND THEN CONFRONTED A DEALERSHIP IN 1/97 ABOUT THE ISSUE.   THEY SAID BECAUSE OF THE LIMITED EDITION COLOR, THE PAINT JOB WOULD BE VERY EXPENSIVE.  THE TOP OF THE VAN HAS SINCE BEGUN TO RUST, AS HAVE SECTIONS OF THE HOOD AND SOME OF THE DR SIDE DOOR.
THE FRONT PASSENGER & DRIVER SIDE SEAT BELT BUCKLES DO NOT LATCH PROPERLY.  ON SEVERAL OCCASION BOTH SEAT BELTS WERE NOT SECURED WHICH COULD RESULT IN SERVERE INJURY IF AN ACCIDENT OCCURED.  *YC

MY WIFE USES THIS VEHICLE.  ON A FAMILY TRIP IN APRIL I HEARD A RATTLING THAT SOUNDED LIKE A DOOR PARTIALLY OPENED BUT I COULD NOT LOCATE THE SOURCE.  A COUPLE DAYS LATER I WENT TO SUPERMARKET AND TRIED TO OPEN THE REAR HATCH WITH MY KEY.  THE REAR HATCH WOULD NOT OPEN.  I USED THE ELECTRIC DOOR LATCH AND THE REAR HATCH OPENED.  AT THIS TIME I NOTICED THE THREE MOUNTING BOLTS FOR THE LOCK MECHANISM WERE GONE.  I PUT IN THREE METRIC BOLTS (SAE BOLTS WOULD NOT FIT IN THE PRESENT HOLES) BUT FOUND THEY LOOSENED OVER TIME.  I FINALLY PUT IN 3 BOLTS WITH LOCK WASHERS AND DOUBLE NUTS TO PREVENT BACK OFF.  I OBSERVED THAT THE METAL WAS TOO SOFT AND FATIGUED BECAUSE THE THREADS WERE NON-EXISTENT, WHICH MEANT IT USE AS A LOCK ASSEMBLY IS INCORRECT AND DANGEROUS.  I HAVE 3 CHILDREN WHO RIDE IN THIS VAN AND I AM VERY CONCERNED.  THIS UNIT WAS REPLACED UNDER A RECALL ON 4/23/96, RECALL #CFXG6405, AUTH CODE 3831, PERFORMED BY CHRYSLER PLYMOUTH OF PARAMUS NEW JERSEY, 234 ROUTE 4 EAST, PHONE 845-0701.  CHRYSLER IS A VERY DIFFICULT COMPANY TO DEAL WITH.  THE CUSTOMER SERVICE IS NOT HELPFUL.  I TRIED CALLING BUT THE LINE IS CONSTANTLY BUSY.  THIS MATTER SHOULD BE INVESTIGATED.  *AK

THE TRANS-AXLE SEEMS TO HAVE A ELECTRICAL GLITCH THAT WILL PREVENT IT FROM SHIFTING GEARS. IF I TURN THE IGNITION OFF AND THEN BACK ON WHILE MOVING FORWARD, THE TRANS WILL SHIFT. I TOOK IT TO THE DEALER TO HAVE IT CHECKED OUT AND THEY SAID I HAVE A CHIP PROBLEM AND THE ONLY WAY IT COULD BE FIXED IS REPLACED WITH A NEW TRANS-AXEL. ($2700.). TODAY THE TRANS STARTED MAKING VERY LOUD NOISE WHEN SHIFTING. I LOOKED UNDER TO SEE IF ANY THING WAS FALLING OUT AND A BRACE THAT SEEMS TO BE A TORQUE BRACE IS BROKEN. I AM GOING TO HAVE THAT LOOKED AT TODAY. HOWEVER THAT IS NOT GOING TO FIX THE SHIFTING. IT SEMS THAT WE ARE BUYING DISPOSABLE CARS NOW DAYS.

THIS IS A KNOWN PROBLEM WITH CHRYSLER.  NUMEROUS OTHER OWNERS I KNOW HAVE HAD EVAPORATORS FAIL RIGHT AFTER WARRANTY PERIOD.  MY VEHICLE HAS 35,000 MILES BUT IS 4 YEARS OLD SO IT IS OUT OF WARRANTY.  BOTH FRONT AND REAR EVAPORATORS HAVE FAILED AT SAME TIME.

I'VE OWNED MANY CARS IN MY LIFE AND HAVE NEVER HAD TO REPLACE A TRANSMISSION.  WITH THIS ONE, WE'VE DONE IT TWICE.  THE FRUSTRATING THING IS CHRYSLER KNEW OF THE PROBLEM AFTER '93 AND DID NOTHING TO FIX IT UNTIL 96.  I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER AMERICAN MADE CAR.  THEY ARE MADE VERY BADLY, AND NOONE SEEMS TO CARE.
